page.title: 11Transport _ Newton area
page.content: Most villagers in this area have their own vehicles as there is virtually no public transport. The nearest main line railway station is 12 miles away at Newark. A private hire coach calls weekly at North Clifton to transport passengers to and from Newark market.A similar firm operates from Newton and Dunham.A supermarket also operates a free bus service to their store. Roads in the area are chiefly 'B' class but the A57 which runs from Lincoln across the Pennines to Lancashire traverses the area. The River Trent is spanned by a privately owned Toll Bridge. Tolls range from 10 pence to 40 pence depending on the size of the vehicle. About 2 million vehicles a year use the bridge. Pedestrians pass free.
